731756f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire in a building.]
731756f-a.text:
Condemned property at corner of Chrystie and Rivington Streets, being
destroyed by firemen.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
731756f-a.folder: Chrystie Street and Rivington Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

718839f-a.title: Manhattan: Chrystie Street - Rivington Street
718839f-a.text:
(1)
Chrystie Street, west side, north from and including Rivington
Street. View shows the Mills House No. 2 at the N.W. corner of
Rivington and Chrystie Streets.
February 14, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, at a later date from a different angle, north from
but not including Delancey Street. In the foreground is the
clearance for Roosevelt Park.
January 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
718839f-a.folder: Chrystie Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

722974f-a.title: Manhattan: Rivington Street - Chrystie Street
722974f-a.text:
Rivington Street, east of Chrystie Street, showing in the background a
station of the Second Ave. Elevated Line. The demolition in the foreground, 1  is for the new Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.
May 9, 1930.
P. L. Sserr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
722974f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Chrystie Street, Manhattan, NY

731755f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire in a building.]
731755f-a.text:
Fire in house to be demolished, at Chrystie near Rivington Streets,
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
